Member Function Documentation

virtual IGuiObject* glr::gui::IGuiComponent::createGuiObject ( const std::wstring &  name)
pure virtual

Create a GUIObject that your gui can use to talk to your application.

This is essentially how you 'bind' objects and methods from your gui to your application.

Parameters
nameThe name associated with this GUIObject
Returns
A pointer to an IGuiObject, or nullptr if the GUIObject could not be created successfully.
virtual void glr::gui::IGuiComponent::executeScript ( const std::wstring &  script)
pure virtual

Execute the code given by script on the current IGuiComponent object.

Parameters
scriptThe code to execute.

virtual bool glr::gui::IGuiComponent::isVisible ( ) const
pure virtual
virtual void glr::gui::IGuiComponent::load ( )
pure virtual

Load the resources necessary for this IGuiComponent object, and also binds GUIObject objects and methods.

Note that any GUIObjects created AFTER load() has been called will not have their objects / methods bound.

virtual void glr::gui::IGuiComponent::setVisible ( bool  isVisible)
pure virtual
virtual void glr::gui::IGuiComponent::unload ( )
pure virtual

Frees the resources used by this IGuiComponent object. Any bindings are also removed.

Note that any GUIObjects still existing are not destroyed - you may call load() again after unload(), and your GUIObjects will be rebound.
